result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew Charles Brieske

defendant.name: Brieske, Andrew Charles
defendant.address: 1608 Commonwealth Dr Apt 6, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538

records.addlTxt:
Pre-trial conference on November 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[ae] case called 11:31 AM Defendant Andrew Charles Brieske appeared by phone, in custody from the Jefferson County Jail.  Attorney Cassi Nelson in court.  ADA Beck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
The Defendant confirms that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $10,000 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence towards any person
--no consumption of alcohol
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs)

recess 11:37 am
NEXT: (1) PTC 11/9/22 at 10:00 am (2) Preliminary Hearing on 11/22/22 at 8:30 am
